title: Physics Concept Reconstruction Education Using Epistemic Game-Based Video Games

context.prior_knowledge: High school-level physics fundamentals (Newtonian mechanics, equations of motion)
context.additional_context: Science education methodology-linked program for pre-service teachers, including experimental activities using digital devices and educational game platforms

learning_goals: Through epistemic goal-setting, learners can accurately explain the interactions of physical variables (angle, velocity, distance) in the Angry Birds game with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can write argumentative essays critically evaluating mass-velocity misconceptions by analyzing in-game experimental data.
Learners can develop instructional plans that design game-based inquiry activities in collaborative/non-collaborative learning environments.

resources: Motion Capture Software for Kinematic Analysis

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
